textContent: Cormorant is a traditional fishing method that uses domestic cormorants to catch sweetfish.In Japan, nobles and samurai have been sightseeing ukai since the Heian period, and ukai is still practiced in various places today.Cormorant fishermen are called cormorants, and their costumes are wind-folded crow hats, fishing clothes, chest pads, and waistcoats, cormorant fishing takes placeIt is from late spring to early autumn, and fishing often begins on the day when the ban on sweetfish is lifted.The ukai of Nagara River, Hedogawa River, and Mikuma River are called the three major ukai because of the large number of sightseeing ukai.You can feel Japanese culture very close by, so please go there.
textContentHtml: Cormorant is a traditional fishing method that uses domestic cormorants to catch sweetfish.In Japan, nobles and samurai have been sightseeing ukai since the Heian period, and ukai is still practiced in various places today.Cormorant fishermen are called cormorants, and their costumes are wind-folded crow hats, fishing clothes, chest pads, and waistcoats, cormorant fishing takes placeIt is from late spring to early autumn, and fishing often begins on the day when the ban on sweetfish is lifted.The ukai of Nagara River, Hedogawa River, and Mikuma River are called the three major ukai because of the large number of sightseeing ukai.You can feel Japanese culture very close by, so please go there.
